Physics Test Questions

JEE/NEET Pattern
1. What is the SI unit of electric current?
The SI unit of electric current is a fundamental unit in the International System of Units.
(A) Volt
(B) Ampere
(C) Ohm
(D) Watt
Explanation: The SI unit of electric current is Ampere (A), named after André-Marie Ampère. One ampere is defined as the constant current that, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed one meter apart in vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2×10⁻⁷ newtons per meter of length.
2. Which of the following is a vector quantity?
Vector quantities have both magnitude and direction, while scalar quantities have only magnitude.
(A) Speed
(B) Distance
(C) Velocity
(D) Time
Explanation: Velocity is a vector quantity as it has both magnitude (speed) and direction. Speed is a scalar quantity that only has magnitude. Distance is also a scalar quantity, while displacement is the vector equivalent of distance.
3. What is the dimensional formula of force?
Force is defined as the rate of change of momentum with respect to time.
(A) [M¹L¹T⁻²]
(B) [M¹L²T⁻²]
(C) [M¹L¹T⁻²]
(D) [M¹L⁰T⁻²]
Explanation: Force = mass × acceleration. The dimensional formula of mass is [M¹] and acceleration is [L¹T⁻²]. Therefore, the dimensional formula of force is [M¹L¹T⁻²].
